ext_description.note:

is only for dummy purposes to fulfill some odd modelling/Express requirements and that users shall savely ignore this.

ext_description.p: A Model_parameter is a type of . A Model_parameter is a formally declared variable provided for an external application to populate at execution time in a computing environment. The unit_of_measure for the Model_parameter shall be consistent with the unit_of_measure for the values assigned to the parameter, either as defaults or through explicit assignment. The default values are explicitly intended to be overridden by explicit assignment, when that explicit assignment references the Model_parameter.
ext_description.example: In Spice, temperature is a Model_parameter that may be set at the execution time.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the for the Model_parameter. The default_value specifies either a or a for the parameter.The value of this attribute need not be specified. When a collection of data types needs to be defined, so that an instance of the collection may be referenced, the is used. The specifies the reference_document to define the semantics of the collection.

specifies the
of the Model_parameter. The value of this attribute need not be specified. There shall be one or more Value_ranges for a Model_parameter. The valid_ranges need not be contiguous.

specifies either an or an identifier for the standard document that contains the reference for the Model_parameter. The reference_document shall define the mapping between the
string values and the semantics to be applied by a simulator, except for the case of .

specifies the string used as the descriptive label for the
of measure associated with the Model_parameter. The value of this attribute need not be specified. The representation of units described in ISO 10303-41 shall be used.

ext_description.p: The reference_document shall be provided and it's size shall be one.

A Parameter_assignment is a type of . A Parameter_assignment is the association of either a or with a , used to provide actual values for characteristics declared formally by the the . The values assigned by the Parameter_assignment shall override any default values specified by the referenced by the attribute. The Parameter_assignment declares to the receiving system that the types that are associated are compatible. It is the responsibility of the sending system to ensure this is the case. Type compatibility is in the end a matter of resolving data dictionaries. This standard provides facilities for ensuring a common data dictionary is available for base types such as length, frequency.

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as the
for the Parameter_assignment.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Parameter_assignment_override is the association between a and another which replaces or overrides the first . Parameter_assignment_override is used when an is referenced but some of the Parameter_assignments need to be replaced.
specifies a role of the for the Parameter_assignment_override.

ext_description.p: specifies a role of the for the Parameter_assignment_override. The binds instance data to data slots in the .
ext_description.note: For each parameter declared in a model definition, an actual value must be assigned when that model is referenced, unless there is a default assignment included in the source code for the model.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Category_model_parameter is a type of . A Category_model_parameter is a formally declared variable of the provided for an external application to populate at execution time in a computing environment. The primary use for a Category_model_parameter is for creation and sharing of catalog data element definitions.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Category_model_parameter is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Category_model_parameter as an .

ext_description.p: A Schema_based_model_parameter is a type of . A Schema_based_model_parameter is a reference to an attribute and entity in a formal model for the purposes of later extracting data from a model instance or populating data in a model instance. The schema identifier uses application of the ASN 1 notation standardized in part 1 of this standard.
ext_description.example: In rule definition, it is often necessary to reference entity data types or their attributes as a parameter.

ext_description.p: specifies the string used as the unambiguous identifier for the schema for the Schema_based_model_parameter.
ext_description.example: The identifier for the AIM schema from ISO 10303-210:2001 is "{ 1 0 10303 210 1 1 1 }".

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the string used as the unambiguous identifier for the attribute name for the Schema_based_model_parameter. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the string used as the unambiguous identifier for the entity name for the Schema_based_model_parameter.
The combination of schema_identifier, entity_name, and attribute_name shall be unique within a population of Schema_based_model_parameters.
A Product_specific_parameter_value_assignment is the assignment of a value to a parameter in the context of a specific .
specifies a role of the for the Product_specific_parameter_value_assignment.
specifies a role of the for the Product_specific_parameter_value_assignment.
The combination of of_product and the_model_parameter shall be unique within a population of Product_specific_parameter_value_assignments.
A Test_method_based_parameter_assignment is a type of .
There shall be exactly one referencing this entity as a member of .
